alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson and northwestern Randolph Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near High Rock Lake, or 11 miles south of Lexington, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... High Point, Asheboro, Denton, Gordontown, High Rock Boat Dock Marina, High Rock Lake Marina & Campground, Martha and High Rock Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
